actions.text: On agreeing to the Benishek amendment (A012) Failed by recorded vote: 208 - 212 (Roll no. 20).
Amendment (A012) offered by Mr. Benishek to the Frelinghuysen amendment (A003).
Roll call votes on amendments in House
Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Benishek amendment (A012) Failed by recorded vote: 208 - 212 (Roll no. 20).
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A012) offered by Mr. Benishek to the Frelinghuysen amendment (A003).

amends_amendment.description: An amendment numbered 1 printed in Part C of House Report 113-1 to provide an additional $33.677 billion in total spending to cover current and anticipated needs in the wake of the devastating Hurricane Sandy. This funding is in addition to the amendment submitted by Chairman Rogers.
amends_amendment.purpose: Amendment provides an additional $33.677 billion in total spending to cover current and anticipated needs in the wake of Hurricane Sandy. As amended, see item 40 (Fleming amendment) and item 42 (Bishop (UT) amendment).

description: An amendment numbered 10 printed in Part C of House Report 113-1 to strike the proviso on line 20, restoring the requirement that local investments are required in Historic Preservation Grants.
purpose: Amendment sought to strike the proviso on line 20, restoring the requirement that local investments would be required in Historic Preservation Grants.
